{"step_by_step_thinking": "In this scenario, the patient's daughter is requesting that the results of the biopsy not be shared with the patient and instead be shared with her and her brother, who is the patient's documented health care proxy. It is important to consider the ethical principles of autonomy and beneficence in this situation. Autonomy refers to the patient's right to make decisions about their own healthcare, and beneficence refers to the duty of healthcare professionals to act in the best interest of the patient. In this case, it is important to respect the patient's autonomy and provide her with the information about her diagnosis. Therefore, the best response would be to tell the patient's daughter that the patient must be informed of the diagnosis.", "answer_choice": "D"}
